trans-unit.source: Provides navigation and a user interface (UI) to collect related data across multiple steps.
In this topic:
[Introduction](#introduction)
[Wizard Components](#components)
[Wizard Steps](#wizard_steps)
[Collecting Wizard Data](#collecting_wizard_data)
[Wizard Command Names](#wizard_command_names)
[Dynamically Changing Steps](#dynamically_changing_steps)
[Wizard Appearance](#wizard_appearance)
[Formatting Using Layout Templates](#formatting_using_layout_templates)
[Accessibility](#accessibility)
[Declarative Syntax](#declarative_syntax)
Introduction
You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control to:
Collect related data across multiple steps.
Break up a larger Web page used to collect user input into smaller logical steps.
Allow for either linear or nonlinear navigation through the steps.
Wizard Components
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is made up of the following components:
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collection of steps that contain the user interface for each step, as defined by the page developer.
Built-in navigation capabilities that determine the appropriate buttons to display based on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.StepType%2A> value.
A header area that can be customized to display information specific to the step that the user is currently on.
A sidebar area that can be used to quickly navigate to steps in the control.
If you are using Microsoft Visual Studio 2005, note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> is persisted in Source view.

If you change the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property in Design view by clicking the sidebar buttons, and you then run the page, the first step of the `Wizard` control might not be shown because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> might be pointing to a different step.
Wizard Steps

Each of the steps in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control has a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.StepType%2A> property that determines the kind of navigation functionality that the step has.
If you do not specify a value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.StepType%2A> property, the default value is <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepType.Auto>.
The following table lists the available settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.StepType%2A> property and the resulting behavior of the step.
The navigation UI that is rendered for the step is determined by the order in which the step is declared.
The step is the last one to appear.
No navigation buttons are rendered.
The step is the last one that collects user data.
The **Finish** button is rendered for navigation.
The step is the first one to appear.
A **Previous** button is not rendered.
The step is any step between the first and last.
**Previous** and **Next** buttons are rendered for navigation.
Collecting Wizard Data
Using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control, data can be collected through linear or nonlinear navigation.
Some examples of nonlinear navigation are skipping unnecessary steps or returning to a previously completed step to change some value.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control maintains its state between steps, so the data entered on a step does not need to be persisted to a data store until all the steps of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control have been completed.

Alternatively, if you want to persist the collected data to a data store as each step is completed, such as when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NextButtonClick> event is raised, you should set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.AllowReturn%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object to `false` so that the user cannot return to a previously completed step and change the data once it has been submitted.
Wizard Command Names

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control inherits the following command names from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> class and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView> class: <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView.NextViewCommandName>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView.PreviousViewCommandName>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView.SwitchViewByIDCommandName>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MultiView.SwitchViewByIndexCommandName>.
The Wizard control ignores these command names and does not include any special logic to enable these commands to automatically work for navigation.
If a command name is removed or is missing from a button in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control, no exception is thrown.
For example, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StartNavigationTemplate%2A> button is missing a value for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.CommandName%2A>, no exception is thrown.
Dynamically Changing Steps

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.MoveTo%2A> method or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> property to dynamically change the step that is currently displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
If you programmatically add a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> in the `Page_Load` event handler, you must add the navigation to that step prior to the page loading.
Wizard Appearance
The appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is fully customizable through templates, skins, and style settings.

For example, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.HeaderTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StartNavigationTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepNavigationTemplate%2A> properties to customize the interface of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

Setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.DisplaySideBar%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.HeaderTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StartNavigationTemplate%2A>, or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepNavigationTemplate%2A> property recreates the child controls of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
As a result, the view state for the child controls is lost in the process.
To avoid this situation, explicitly maintain the control state of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control's child controls explicitly, or avoid putting controls inside of templates.
Note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control does not support special Microsoft Internet Explorer rendering for non-standard or quirks mode.
To get the best Internet Explorer rendering using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control, use the XHTML doc type, which is added by default in Visual Web Developer and Visual Studio.
Formatting Using Layout Templates
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control lets you specify the layout of the control without requiring you to use an HTML `table` element.
Instead, you can use a `LayoutTemplate` element to specify the layout.
In the template, you create placeholder controls to indicate where items should be dynamically inserted into the control.

(This is similar to how the template model for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control works.) For more information, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.LayoutTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Accessibility

For information about how to configure this control so that it generates markup that conforms to accessibility standards, see [Accessibility in Visual Studio and ASP.NET](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7e3ce9c4-6b7d-4fb1-94b5-72cf2a44fe13) and [ASP.NET Controls and Accessibility](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/847a37e3-ce20-41da-b0d3-7dfb0fdae9a0).
Declarative Syntax
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> class.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.%23ctor%2A> constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> class.
Gets the step in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps"></xref> collection that is currently displayed to the user.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStep%2A> property returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object that is currently displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStep%2A> property is read-only; however, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStep%2A> property to access the properties of the current <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> property to dynamically change the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStep%2A> to a different <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object.
Alternatively, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.MoveTo%2A> method to dynamically set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStep%2A> property.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> that is currently displayed to the user.

The corresponding <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex"></xref> is less than -1 or greater than the number of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> objects in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
Occurs when the user switches to a new step in the control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepChanged> event is raised when the current step that is displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control changes.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepChanged> event to provide additional processing when the current step of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control changes.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Gets or sets the index of the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> object.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> property provides the zero-based index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object that is currently displayed in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
You can programmatically set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> property to control which step is displayed to the user at run time.
If you are using Microsoft Visual Studio 2005, note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> is persisted in Source view.

If you change the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property in Design view by clicking the sidebar buttons, and you then run the page, the first step of the `Wizard` control might not be shown because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> might be pointing to a different step.
If you set the value of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> to -1 to support a wizard with no steps by default, the following behavior occurs:
If you declaratively set <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> to -1 or set it to -1 as a default value, the control will always try to render the first step in the wizard.
If you programmatically set <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> to -1, the control will not render.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> that is currently displayed in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.
The selected value is higher than the number of wizard steps defined in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps"></xref> collection.

Uses a Boolean value to determine whether the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStep"></xref> property can be set to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> object that corresponds to the index that is passed in.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.AllowNavigationToStep%2A> method can be accessed from a derived class only because of its `protected` modifier.

In a derived class, you can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.AllowNavigationToStep%2A> method to determine whether the index that is passed in can be used to set the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.AllowNavigationToStep%2A> method will return `false` if the index that is passed in refers to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object that has already been accessed and has its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.AllowReturn%2A> property set to `false`; otherwise, it will return `true`.
The index of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> object being checked.

`false` if the index passed in refers to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> that has already been accessed and its <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase.AllowReturn"></xref> property is set to `false`; otherwise, `true`.
Occurs when the **Cancel** button is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonClick> event is raised when the **Cancel** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is clicked.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonClick> event to provide additional processing when the **Cancel** button is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Specifies the identifier for the **Cancel** button.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonID> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonID> is `"CancelButton"`.
Gets or sets the URL of the image displayed for the **Cancel** button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonType%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType.Image>, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonImageUrl%2A> property to specify the image to display for the **Cancel** button.
The URL of the image displayed for the **Cancel** button on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.
The default value is an empty string ("").
Gets a reference to a collection of style properties that define the appearance of the **Cancel** button.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonStyle%2A> property defines the appearance for the **Cancel** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonStyle%2A> property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `CancelButtonStyle-ForeColor`).
You can set a property programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `CancelButtonStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonStyle%2A> property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.

Any setting that is applied in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonStyle%2A> property overrides the corresponding setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that defines the style settings for **Cancel** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
Gets or sets the text caption that is displayed for the **Cancel** button.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonText%2A> property contains the text that is displayed for the **Cancel** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

Depending on the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonType%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonText%2A> property can appear as text on a button, as text displayed as an alternative to an image, or as the text of a link.
The following table lists the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelButtonType%2A> values and their respective effects on the **Cancel** button text.
Text appears on the button.
Text appears as alternative text for the image.
Text appears as a link.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text caption displayed for **Cancel** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is "Cancel".
The default text for the control is localized based on the current locale for the server.
Gets or sets the type of button that is rendered as the **Cancel** button.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType.Button"></xref>.
Retrieves the command name for the **Cancel** button.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelCommandName> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelCommandName> is `"Cancel"`.
Gets or sets the URL that the user is directed to when they click the **Cancel** button.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelDestinationPageUrl%2A> property specifies the step that is displayed when the user clicks the **Cancel** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.DisplayCancelButton%2A> property is set to `true` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CancelDestinationPageUrl%2A> property is not set, the Web page is refreshed and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.OnCancelButtonClick%2A> event is raised.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
The URL that the user is redirected to when they click **Cancel** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the amount of space between the contents of the cell and the cell border.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CellPadding%2A> property to control the spacing between the contents of a cell and the cell border.
The padding amount that is specified is added to all four sides of the cell.
All cells in a column share the same cell width; therefore, the spacing is applied to the widest cell in the column.
Similarly, all cells in the same row share the same cell height.
Thus, the spacing is applied to the tallest cell in the row.
Individual cell sizes cannot be specified.
The amount of space, in pixels, between the contents of a cell and the cell border.
The default is 0.
Gets or sets the amount of space between cells.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CellSpacing%2A> property to control the spacing between adjacent cells in a Wizard control.
This spacing is applied both vertically and horizontally.
The amount of space, in pixels, between cells.
The default is 0.
Creates child controls.
Creates control collection.
Creates the hierarchy of child controls that make up the control.
The sidebar template does not contain a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> control.
Creates control style.
Retrieves the identifier for a custom **Finish** button.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CustomFinishButtonID> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CustomFinishButtonID> is `"CustomFinishButton"`.
Retrieves the identifier for a custom **Next** button.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CustomNextButtonID> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CustomNextButtonID> is `"CustomNextButton"`.
Retrieves the identifier for a custom **Previous** button.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CustomPreviousButtonID> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.CustomPreviousButtonID> is `"CustomPreviousButton"`.
Retrieves the identifier for the sidebar <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList"></xref> collection.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.DataListID> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.DataListID> is `"SideBarList"`.
Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether to display a **Cancel** button.
`true` to display **Cancel** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether to display the sidebar area on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.
There can be a difference in the rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control depending on whether this property is set to `true` or `false`.
When this property value is set to `true` and the sidebar is displayed, cell spacing is not applied to the `HeadCell`, `StepCell`, or `NavigationCell` elements of the control's table.
When this value is `false`, cell spacing is applied.
This may affect how the control is rendered.
`true` to display the sidebar area on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref href="System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute"></xref> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
Occurs when the **Finish** button is clicked.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishButtonClick> event is raised when the **Finish** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control is clicked.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishButtonClick> event to provide additional processing when the **Finish** button is clicked.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Retrieves the identifier for the **Finish** button.
This field is static and read-only.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishButtonID> field is used primarily by control developers.
The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishButtonID> is `"FinishButton"`.
Gets or sets the URL of the image that is displayed for the **Finish** button.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonType%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType.Image> field, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonImageUrl%2A> property to specify the image to display for the **Finish** button.
The URL of the image displayed for **Finish** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets a reference to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that defines the settings for the **Finish** button.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonStyle%2A> property defines the appearance for the **Finish** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonStyle%2A> property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `CancelButtonStyle-ForeColor`).
You can set a property programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `CancelButtonStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonStyle%2A> property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.

Any setting that is applied in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonStyle%2A> property overrides the corresponding setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that defines the style settings for **Finish** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
Gets or sets the text caption that is displayed for the **Finish** button.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonText%2A> property contains the text that is displayed for the **Finish** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

Depending on the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonType%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonText%2A> property can appear as text on a button, as text displayed as an alternative to an image in browsers that do not render images, or as the text of a link.
The following table lists the field values for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishCompleteButtonType%2A> property and the respective effect of each on the **Finish** button text.
Text appears on the button.
Text appears as alternative text for the image.
Text appears as link text.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text caption displayed for **Finish** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is "Finish".
The default text for the control is localized based on the current locale for the server.
Gets or sets the type of button that is rendered as the **Finish** button.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType.Button"></xref>.
Gets or sets the URL that the user is redirected to when they click the **Finish** button.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishDestinationPageUrl%2A> property specifies the step that is displayed when the user clicks the **Finish** button on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).
The URL that the user is redirected to when they click **Finish** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is an empty string ("").
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the navigation area on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepType.Finish"></xref> step.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A> property to specify the custom content that is displayed for the navigation area on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepType.Finish> step of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
Define the content by creating a template that specifies how the navigation area is rendered on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepType.Finish> step.
The custom content for the template is contained within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A> object.

You can add custom content to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A> object either by using template-editing mode in design view or by defining the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A> object inline using `FinishNavigationTemplate` tags.
The content can be as simple as plain text or more complex (embedding other controls in the template, for example).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A> object that is contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishNavigationTemplate%2A> property must contain two <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> controls, one with its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.CommandName%2A> property set to "MoveComplete" and the other with its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl.CommandName%2A> property set to "MovePrevious", to enable the navigation feature.

To access a control that is defined in a template programmatically, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl.Controls%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> object.

You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> object to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property specified.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> that defines the content for the navigation area for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepType.Finish"></xref> on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishPreviousButtonStyle%2A> property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `CancelButtonStyle-ForeColor`).
You can set a property programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `CancelButtonStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishPreviousButtonStyle%2A> property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.

Any setting that is applied in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishPreviousButtonStyle%2A> property overrides the corresponding setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.

Depending on the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishPreviousButtonType%2A> property, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishPreviousButtonText%2A> property can appear as text on a button, as text displayed as an alternative to an image in browsers that do not render images, or as the text of a link.

Text appears on the button.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.GetHistory%2A> method returns a collection containing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects that have been accessed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects are arranged in the order in which they were accessed: the first item in the collection is the previous <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object, the second item in the collection is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> object that was accessed before the previous step, and so on.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> objects that have been accessed.

The style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property are merged with the individual button styles.
Any setting that is applied in the individual button style properties overrides the corresponding setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.

For example, if you set the `FinishPreviousButtonStyle.ForeColor` property to `"red"` and the `NavigationButtonStyle.ForeColor` property to `"green"`, the color for the button will be red because the individual style settings of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.FinishPreviousButtonStyle%2A> property override the settings of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationButtonStyle%2A> property.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonClick> event to provide additional processing when a button in the sidebar area is clicked.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonClick> event does not raise an event if a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button> control with the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Button.CommandName%2A> property set to `Move` is outside of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control's sidebar list for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A> object.

Retrieves the identifier that is associated with each of the sidebar buttons.
This field is static and read-only.

The value for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonID> is `"SideBarButton"`.
Gets a reference to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that defines the settings for the buttons on the sidebar.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonStyle%2A> property defines the appearance of the buttons on the sidebar of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonStyle%2A> property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `CancelButtonStyle-ForeColor`).
You can set a property programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `CancelButtonStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.
The style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonStyle%2A> property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

Any settings that are applied in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarButtonStyle%2A> property override the corresponding settings in the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

The placeholder ID must be set to "sideBarPlaceHolder".

Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

Any settings that are applied in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarStyle%2A> property override the corresponding settings in the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
The height property for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarStyle%2A> is ignored if the height is set to less than the height of the wizard.
Values set for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationStyle%2A> height and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.HeaderStyle%2A> height add to the total height of the wizard.

For example, if the Wizard height is set to 500px and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.NavigationStyle%2A> height or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.HeaderStyle%2A> height is set to 50px or 10%, then the total wizard height is 550px.
The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> style properties are overridden by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarStyle%2A> settings:
A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that defines the style settings for the sidebar area on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
Gets or sets the template that is used to display the sidebar area on the control.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A> property to specify the custom content that is displayed for the sidebar area on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
Define the content by creating a template that specifies how the sidebar area is rendered.
The custom content for the template is contained within the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A> object.

You can add custom content to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A> object either by using template-editing mode in design view or by defining the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A> object inline using `SideBarTemplate` tags.
The content can be as simple as plain text or more complex (embedding other controls in the template, for example).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SideBarTemplate%2A> object must contain a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> control or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control whose <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property is set to `"SideBarList"` to enable the sidebar navigation feature.

Also, the `"SideBarList"` on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataList> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListView> control must contain an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.IButtonControl> control.

To access a control that is defined in a template programmatically, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CompositeControl.Controls%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> object.

You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> object to find the control, if the control has an <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property specified.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.ITemplate"></xref> that contains the template for displaying the sidebar area on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Gets or sets a value that is used to render alternate text that notifies screen readers to skip the content in the sidebar area.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SkipLinkText%2A> property to specify the alternate text for a hidden image that is read by screen readers to provide the ability to skip the content for a sidebar area.
The text that you specify provides assistive technology devices with a description of the hidden image that can be used to make the control more accessible.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.DisplaySideBar%2A> property is set to `false`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.SkipLinkText%2A> property does not create a hidden image with alternate text.
The value of this property, when set, can be saved automatically to a resource file by using a designer tool.
For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
A string that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> renders as alternate text with an invisible image, as a hint to screen readers.
The default is "Skip Navigation Links".
The default text for the control is localized based on the current locale for the server.

Gets or sets the template that is used to display the navigation area on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepType.Start"></xref> step of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.

For more information, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.LocalizableAttribute> and [Globalization and Localization](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/8ef3838e-9d05-4236-9dd0-ceecff9df80d).
The text caption displayed for **Previous** on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
The default is "Previous".
The default text for the control is localized based on the current locale for the server.
Gets or sets the type of button that is rendered as the **Previous** button.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ButtonType.Button"></xref>.
Gets a reference to a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that defines the settings for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepStyle%2A> property gets a reference to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that defines the appearance for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> objects on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepStyle%2A> property is read-only; however, you can set the properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object that it returns.

You can set these properties declaratively in the form `Property-Subproperty`, where `Subproperty` represents a property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> class (for example, `CancelButtonStyle-ForeColor`).
You can set a property programmatically in the form `Property.Subproperty` (for example, `CancelButtonStyle.ForeColor`).
Common settings include custom background color, text color, and font properties.

The style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepStyle%2A> property are merged with the style settings for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Style%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

Any setting that is applied in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepStyle%2A> property overrides the corresponding setting in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Style%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

The following <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepStyle%2A> properties can be set to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.Style%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control:

When you use a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TemplatedWizardStep> template to define the appearance for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep> objects, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.StepStyle%2A> property has no effect.

A reference to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that defines the style settings for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep"></xref> objects on the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> value that corresponds to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.TagKey%2A> property is used primarily by control developers to extend the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> value that corresponds to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.
Tracks view state.
Gets the ID of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStep"></xref> placeholder in a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref> control.
The placeholder ID must be set to "WizardStepPlaceHolder".
Gets a collection containing all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> objects that are defined for the control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property returns a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects that make up the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> collection to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects that are contained in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control programmatically.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Remove%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Clear%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection.Insert%2A> methods to manipulate the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase> objects in the collection programmatically.
If you are using Microsoft Visual Studio 2005, note that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> is persisted in Source view.

If you change the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.WizardSteps%2A> property in Design view by clicking the sidebar buttons, and you then run the page, the first step of the `Wizard` control might not be shown because the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard.ActiveStepIndex%2A> might be pointing to a different step.
If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard> control contains multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection> collections, the collections will be merged.
This property cannot be set by themes or style sheet themes.
For more information, see <xref:System.Web.UI.ThemeableAttribute> and [ASP.NET Themes and Skins](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/5df3ebbd-d46c-4502-9406-02f9df4ef2c3).

A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepCollection"></xref> representing all the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WizardStepBase"></xref> objects defined for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Wizard"></xref>.
